etymologies: Middle English: from Old French ostriche, from Latin avis ‘bird’ + late Latin struthio (from Greek strouthiōn ‘ostrich’, from strouthos ‘sparrow or ostrich’)

definitions: a flightless swift-running African bird with a long neck, long legs, and two toes on each foot. It is the largest living bird, with males reaching an average height of 8 feet (2.5 m).

notes.text: Struthio camelus, the only member of the family Struthionidae

shortDefinitions: flightless swift-running African bird with long neck

definitions: a person who refuses to face reality or accept facts
etymologies: from the popular belief that ostriches bury their heads in the sand if pursued

examples.text: don't be an ostrich when it comes to security systems

shortDefinitions: person who refuses to face reality or accept facts
